result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse M Kindt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Present Sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit.   Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent.

No Contact with the CI in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Comply with any Mental Health / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended. Maintain employment and/or school combination.
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse M Kindt in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Neither party has any modifications/corrections to the presentnece investigation.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Szczewski makes statements regarding sentencing.  Shannon S. makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #3:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT         **Consescutive to present sentence**
  -  2 YEARS  OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS  OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: CI in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

BUY MONEY:  $740.00 to Metro Drug Unit  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH
Sentencing hearing on April 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
from Dodge Correctional

Defendant Jesse M Kindt in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.   Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #3.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #3.  Repeater enhancer is stricken.  Counts #1 & 2 are dismissed and read-in.  State requests a presentence investigation.  Court orders presentence investigation and sets sentencing date.   DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH.    Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Dodge Correctional.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
